Name: Asking for Trobils: Scoundrels – Ship Package 1
Description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Alyssa
The Centurion Hawk

Name: Asking for Trobils: Travelers – Ship Package 2
Description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The T.R.O.B.A.S.
The Zemeckis

Name: Asking for Trobils: Bounty Hunters – Ship Package 3
Description:
Each Ship type comes with a Ship card and 4 of the Ship Minis.

Contains:
The Knifs's Edge
The Seeker

Name: Vigilante: Story Mode
Description:
In Story Mode, you and your friends each lead a team of heroes in an ever-changing campaign to rid the city of crime.

You will start off as agents working together in this 10-chapter campaign. Each chapter brings fun new twists, as you recruit new heroes and find useful equipment to bring from chapter to chapter.

In Chapter 1, The Agency is putting you to the test. Choose your weapon and work with your fellow agents as you combat mechanical foes.

In Chapter 2, take to the streets to take down Dino Gambino and his criminal empire. Meet new heroes, find useful gadgets, and save those in need - how you win is just as important as winning!

Vigilante: Story Mode is a standalone cooperative campaign that is compatible with Vigilante, featuring hundreds of new cards and other content to enhance your game.

-description from designer

Name: Asking for Trobils: Bonus Items
Description:
Contains:
Wormhole
Bag
Ship
Ship Card
Achievement Cards

Name: Ubongo Lines
Description:
All players will try to compete by building the same pattern shown on the card as quickly as possible, using three-dimensional rectangular blocks. After 9 ores, the players add up the points. Whoever gets the most of them wins. Four difficulty levels allow you to adjust the game to the age and experience of the players.

The competition consisting in building the same pattern by all players at the same time introduces much more emotions than in the basic version or in Ubongo 3D.

This is the world's first release of this version of Ubongo!

Name: Hunt A Killer: The Cosmic Adventure Of Supernova
Description:
After signing up for a membership to The Official Supernova Fan Club, you are contacted by Gunny Graham, the reclusive series creator. For over a decade, he has been unsuccessful at contacting his twin sister, Halo. He believes she’s still somewhere out there, alive, but in the clutches of The Void. He needs your help to find his sister before he loses her forever.

In this all-in-one box, you’ll receive evidence from Gunny Graham that will reveal the whereabouts of his sister.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decode mysterious dark symbols of The Void.

Translate the alien language, "Aquarian," pore over vintage documents, and sort through superhero merchandise to find Gunny’s twin sister.

Your choices matter! This game has two different endings, and you determine the outcome of the story.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium

Note: In order to play this game, you will need a Hunt a Killer account so they may send you an epilogue.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hunt A Killer: 1973 Remastered
Description:
After the murder of their lead singer Darryl Fanton, FLUF became one of the most popular cult bands of the 1970’s. Although the police ruled it an open and shut case, there are still many unanswered questions and loose ends. 25 years after the murder, can you finally close the case of 1973? This box is packed with high quality items, easter eggs, and is one of the most intricate premium investigations that Hunt A Killer has to offer!

In this all-in-one box you will uncover the hidden story of a legendary rock group cut down in its prime by a gruesome murder.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to finally serve justice in this decades old cold-case.

This box includes an original album, a FLUF bandana, and other memorabilia that fully immerses you into the story. Each item relates to the overall mystery and it's up to you to find out how.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

This is an updated/revised edition of Hunt a Killer: 1973. The main changes to gameplay include expanding one of the in-game websites and adding a new cipher to it, adding hints and tweaking some of the language found within the box’s clues for a more focused experience, and replacing the t-shirt with a new band poster.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hunt A Killer: Fine Art Foul Play
Description:
A deductive reasoning mystery game that is great for players of any level! When the matriarch of a family of artists is found dead at the opening of her art exhibit, you must identify who within her circle is the killer. You must act fast though; her daughter has been accused of the crime and her trial is rapidly approaching!

In this all-in-one box you’ll take on the role of an experienced but out-of-practice private investigator and review clues to rule out suspects.

Rule out suspects based on their lack of means, motive, or opportunity. Review fingerprints, handwriting, lab reports, and deductive reason to progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

Difficulty: 2/5

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hunt A Killer: The Melancholy Killer
Description:
In this story by Peter Gillespie (America’s Most Wanted), a convicted serial killer mysteriously leaves you his belongings after being murdered in prison. Thousands of people believed he was innocent, and as protests erupt around the country, it is up to you to solve the mystery of the Melancholy Killer.

In this all-in-one box, you’ll examine the life of Edward Lee Dwyer and the prison riot that led to his death. Enjoy 5-7 hours of gameplay, no subscription required.

Solve puzzles, examine clues, and decrypt ciphers to unveil the truth about the coast-to-coast murders.

The Melancholy Killer’s personal briefcase will be delivered to your door. Examine official prison documents and other personal belongings from the hands of the serial killer.

Difficulty: 5/5 - Hard

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hunt A Killer: Camp Calamity
Description:
When the staff of Camp Ashburne find a counselor’s charred remains in the embers of last night’s bonfire, the authorities are quick to rule it an unfortunate accident. However, one of the counselors discovers new evidence that suggests it was something much more sinister. Something dangerous is being cooked up at Camp Ashburne, and only you can solve this burning case! Do you have what it takes?

In this all-in-one box, you’ll review suspects’ statements and comb through evidence to determine the means, motives, and opportunities of each suspect.

Solve puzzles that will test your critical thinking, powers of deduction, and code cracking skills.

Use your cunning to unlock new evidence by discovering hidden messages that progress you through a gripping murder mystery where nothing is as it seems.

Difficulty: 4/5 - Medium

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hunt A Killer: Ghastly Manor
Description:
Your expert team of ghost hunters has been called in to investigate an old inn that is being haunted by five ghosts. But this job may be more than what you bargained for and if you’re not careful you’ll be joining their ranks! Explore the manor, uncover their weaknesses, and banish them to the beyond!

In this all-in-one box, you will need to keep nerves and wits in order to survive the night.

You will have to channel your inner paranormal investigator. Find each ghost, discover what keeps them tethered to the physical plane, and answer their riddles to rid the manor of its infestation!

You will need to use items to interact with ghosts, decipher hidden codes, and make decisions that are life or death!

Difficulty: 1/5 - Easy

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander Legends
Description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering is the first-ever draftable Commander experience!

In the Commander format, players have a legendary creature who serves as the deck's commander. That creature is set aside at the start of the game, and can be cast as if it were in your hand. Normally, this is done with a 100-card singleton constructed deck. However, Commander Legends gives it a new twist. When drafting Commander Legends, each player opens a 20-card booster pack, selects two cards from it, and then passes the pack to the player sitting next to them. They then pick two more cards from the pack they've been handed, and so on, going around the table until all cards are picked. This is repeated with a second booster pack, and again with a third, until everyone has picked a total of 60 cards. Players then choose a commander (or a pair of commanders that both have the Partner ability) from among the cards they drafted, add any number of basic lands, and build a 60-card deck. Then everyone shuffles up their decks and battles in a free-for-all! (A larger pod of drafters splits into two groups first.)

The set is sold in draft boosters and collector boosters, and contains 361 cards (141 commons, 120 uncommons, 77 rares, and 22 mythic rares, plus the Prismatic Piper, a special helper card who appears more frequently than a common), plus a selection of 32 legendary reprints from past sets who appear with an all-new foil-etched treatment in collector boosters and, on rare occasion, in draft boosters as well. Two preconstructed Commander decks, "Arm for Battle" and "Reap the Tides," were also released alongside the main set.

Name: Combat of the 30: Chivalric Combat in 14th Century Brittany
Description:
Combat of the 30 pitches 2 players together in a small battlefield. Each player controls 30 knights, who have sworn to defeat the other side in order to win the bloody War of Breton Succession.

Each side is divided into 3 wings, which are activated and controlled in an innovative way in order to have as little downtime between turns.

Combat of the 30 melds historical wargaming with accessibility, and teaches players about this formative event in the history of European Chivalry.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Nay-Jay!: Expansion Pack!
Description:
Expansion for Nay-Jay! Extends the original game from four decks to six thereby allowing for six players. Aim is to get rid of all your cards by simultaneously placing cards on a number pile in numerical and colour order.

"Forget taking turns and playing it coll. This game is HOT HOT HOT! Flip your deck and flip your lid. Your friends and family will go wild! Nay-Jay is a rip-roarin' hootin' and hollerin' good time!

Each player races to play their own cards, building up and down on the shared number piles. Flipping cards, slapping cards and sometimes throwing cards, everyone competes to get their cards played first!

If you count to ten and back while doing the Hokey-Pokey, you can play Nay-Jay! If you can do all that while running from a ferocious tiger, you might win. 
 Get ready to play the fastest card game you'll ever lay your hands on. Nay-Jay is about to blow you away! - Designer blurb"

Name: Arch-hunt
Description:
Architecture is around us us, from our house to the museum we visited on our last trip. It is our daily environment.

It is not necessary to know architecture to consider certain buildings iconic: they are the ones that give identity to our cities. The aim of this game is to to get the best collection of this architectural icons... avoiding the obstacles put by the rest of the players!

Arch-hunt is an English contraction of "architecture-hunter". It is a game that aims to promote architecture by giving visibility to some of the most emblematic buildings of the 20th and 21st centuries. But its main purpose is to entertain during games in which resource management and strategy will be essential to win.

Each player represents an era through a famous architect. The goal of each player is to get as many points as possible by building the best collection of iconic buildings. To do this, each player must build 8 buildings using coins and cards from their hand. It is, therefore, a management and strategy game in which luck plays an important role. The game ends when a player manages to complete his collection, but this does not mean that he wins the game: the value of the buildings and the possible bonuses at the end of the game can make the difference.

—description from the publisher

Name: Toumaï
Description:
In a race to the star, three magicians release their five birds towards the heart of the closest star to bring them back three magic wands that will turn the sky in their favorite color. The third wand will be the right one.

The first player to get 3 magic wands wins the game.

MOVES
Each player in turn (clockwise) plays one of their top-line pawns (the closest to the center of the star) ; the pieces make circular movements, clockwise or counterclockwise, to land on the top square of the line they just joined.

     A bird of strength 1 must join the nearest line, either to its right or left.
     A bird of strength 2 will join a line two tracks further to its right or left.
     A bird of strength 3, will join a line three tracks further, to its right or left.
     A magician has the choice between these 3 routes.


Empty tracks are not counted in the pawn’s moves. More the game evolve, more the empty spaces between the tracks are big.
A pawn can move alone, or take with it all or part of the pawns in its line, even if they are neutral or of the opponent's color ; the pawns taken along join the same line as their top pawn, behind it and in the same order.
The pawns of the "neutral color" can only move with the top pawns of the playing colors.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jinns of the lake
Description:
On the fortieth day in the desert, a traveler discovers the Lake of Wishes. The Jinns of the Lake hire him as an architect to help them to build the Towers of Dreams. Whoever builds the most beautiful towers will win. A game of strategy where diplomacy and negotiation are used to support the spirit of conquest.

To earn the most points by building "Dream-towers" covered by your color (a Dream-tower has maximum 4 floors made of 1 pawn of each color).

Each player in turn moves a Dome-pawn of the color(s) they control, either to its right or its left, to stack on another Dome-pawn.

     A Dome-pawn of strength 1 must be placed on the first free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
     A Dome-pawn of strength 2 must land on the second free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
     A Dome-pawn of strength 3 will necessarily land on the third free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.
     A Dome-pawn of strength 4 will necessarily land on the fourth free dome (alone or already stacked) to its right or its left.


When moving, players may move their Dome-pawn alone, or with the entire tower, or only part of the tower they control on top.

—description from the publisher

Name: Teufelsbrücke
Description:
A bridge is built by 13 small open boxes distinguished by 4 colors. Dice rolls decide in which box and how many jungle animals you have to add to or to take from one box of the bridge. Play clockwise until the bridge collapses.

—user summary

Hilfe! Die Brücke schwankt - Wer bleibt cool und hat die ruhigste Hand?
Unten am Fluß lauern schon die Krokodile. Stürzt die Teufelsbrücke mit den Urwaldtieren ein, oder gibt's noch eine Rettung?
Reihum setzt ihr Urwaldtiere in die einzelnen Brückenteile. Dies geht so lange gut, bis die Brücke einstürzt. Wer es so geschickt anstellt, dass die Brücke erst beim nächsten Spieler einstürzt, gewinnt das Spiel.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Master Dater: Big Love Edition
Description:
The Gamefound Exclusive Edition of Master Dater! You want it all and you can have it. Includes all Master Dater unlocks (like the Uncut expansion). The NSFW expansion (in its packaging), added cards, love letter, stickers, pins and other, upcoming, unlocks will come packaged inside the Big Love box.

CONTENTS
Rule sheet
95 Head Cards
95 Body Cards
217 “Interest” Cards
72 Flames
72 Sparks
73 Hearts
The Master Dater "Uncut" Expansion
Dating Hazzard: 10 Love-Themed Joking Hazard Cards

Also includes ALL Master Dater unlocks!

Name: Kriegs-Spiel, zur angenehmen Unterhaltung für Offiziere und gebildete Stände
Description:
Wargame played on a 75x99 cm game board with a square grid, each grid representing 200x200 paces of terrain of a hypothetical battlefield with generic blue and red armies. Played with approximately 75 cardboard square pieces representing 10 different types of military units and hundreds of smaller cardboard markers used for things like terrain that is demolished or on fire.

It was meant to be easier to learn and play in a shorter time than contemporary wargames, according to the rulebook.

Unlike most boardgames from this era this game was sold in a cardboard box with all components included. Game board was unmounted with instructions to glue it to thicker paper or cardboard. All game components were unpainted with included instructions what colors to paint board and pieces in.

Name: A&A Arnhem '44: Operation Market Garden
Description:
At Last – A&A Arnhem ’44 – Operation Market Garden!
This new series from cadet is called the Armies and Alliances series (A&A). The first in this series is no surprise – it’s “A&A Arnhem ’44.”  With the familiar miniatures representing tanks, infantry, artillery, 88s, fighters, bombers, Airborne units and Waffen SS, this game is exactly what the community has been waiting for. 52 Action cards enhance the historical “storyboard” of the battle while a simple, yet realistic combat system means every decision and roll of the dice makes a difference. With a big, beautiful map created by Marc Von Martial and an easy-to-read large-print highly-illustrated rulebook, this game is ready to hit the table the minute you get the shrink wrap off! 
The game has 114 minis and 52 game cards, plus the map is two big, bad 22x34 mounted sections that fold out and fit together for the ultimate Market-Garden experience.  All segments of the campaign are included - from Eindhoven through "hell's highway" to Nijmegen and the dangerous route to Arnhem to cross the lower Rhine.  The players get to re-fight the whole battle from the initial airborne drops to the final showdown between the II SS Panzer Corps and Allied XXX Corps.  Supply, Air combat and ground attack, Drop Zones, Engineer, Air defense and Reinforcements are all included - along with leadership effects, historical events, and plenty of "easy" chrome built into the design via the event cards.  It's only 10 simple turns and it plays quickly, but even the hardcore gaming enthusiast will discover a well-balanced challenge that is not to be taken for granted!
Can you capture the bridges along “Hell’s Highway” and hold them long enough for the XXX Corps to make it over the Rhine at Arnhem? Or will you dash the allied plans as the German player, slamming the door on the bold allied gamble? This one can go either way every time – history depends on YOU.

Name: The Miniature Book of Miniature Golf
Description: Dexterity game of minigolf in a form of a "book". Game is played used miniature golf club and a tiny golf ball. Game contains 9 fairways with varying themes. Player with least strokes at the end is the winner.

Name: nook
Description:
Oh no! The client hired too many interior designers to redecorate their nook! Try to win the client’s favor by quickly throwing down your own designs for how the nook should look.

Be the first player to empty your hand to win the round. Win 3 rounds to win the game and the title of Best Interior Decorator!

—description from the designer

Name: Death Ride Normandy: Juno Beach
Description:
The Canadian 3rd Infantry Division, landing to the west of the 3rd British Infantry Division, made good gains on D-Day and looked like it would be able to advance on Caen on the 7th without problem.  After consolidating for the night the Candians moved out smartly in the morning to the south along the road to Carpiquet Airport to the west of the city of Caen.  Not long after starting out, and strung out in a long column, they came under intense and sustained fire from the 12SS Panzer Division.  The fight between these 2 divisions would become legendary during the campaign and filled with vicious combat.

—description from the designer

Name: Magic: The Gathering — Innistrad: Double Feature
Description:
This special limited-edition booster expansion for Magic: The Gathering contains all the cards from Innistrad: Midnight Hunt and Innistrad: Crimson Vow in a unique black-and-white style.

Each booster pack of Innistrad: Double Feature contains 7 cards Midnight Hunt and 7 cards from Crimson Vow (4 commons, 2 uncommons, and 1 rare each), plus 1 card from either of the two sets in an all-new "Silver Screen" foil treatment that resembles the traditional foils seen in other sets, except that the sheen on them is silver instead of rainbow.

Name: A game about quickly matching words to pictures but never words to words or pictures to pictures.
Description:
A realtime game where you match pictures with a word that describes that picture.

There are 4 objects and 3 colours. A red bed could be matched either with the word 'red' or the word 'bed'.

As soon as a match is made, the cards are taken and that will often reveal another match in a sort-of chain reaction!

Whoever takes the most cards wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Dragon Braggarts
Description:
"So, Commander, you hear about that whopper of a dragon over in Norwich area? They say he's a real monster."
"Yeah, so what if he is?"
"Bet 7 of my knights could take care of him. They're good lads."
"Hah! 7 of your knights? I'd only need 3 of mine! Well... 4 if one of 'em is Sir Smarty-pants over there."
"4 knights?! That's impossible! I'd like to see you try!"
"You want me to prove it? All right, men! Suit up! We're off to Norwich!"

In Dragon Braggarts, players guess how many knights they need to defeat the dragon, scoring points if they are correct.  However, only the biggest braggart (or rather the player who needs the fewest knights to successfully defeat the dragon) will be the one to snag the points. Using their cunning, estimation, and good old-fashioned luck, one player will earn the title of Grand Dragon Master!

—description from the designer

Name: 2000's A Decade of Trivia
Description: 2000s A Decade of Trivia is a turn of the century game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for millennials and more.

Name: Digital Transformation Card Game
Description:
The aim of the Digital Transformation Card Game is to offer an entertaining and easily accessible way to learn about the many aspects of digital transformation, its underlying drivers of change, methods and technologies connected with that change and particularly the many ways to combine any of these into a winning strategy.

Feel free to use the cards in any way you desire:
For example try to play your favorite card game with the digital transformation set of cards, e.g. Poker, or develop new rules to create your very own game. At the back of the pack you will find rule-sets for Digital Power Black Jack, Go Fish Digital Powers!, Digital Memory, Digital Moving Puzzle and a suggestion how to use it in a consultancy setting.

—description from the designer

Name: Color Strike
Description:
You steal good Cards, give away bad cards like lightning and you never confess color.

Build a secret straigth of 6 cards in the right color order by thinking tactically and quickly.
With the highest score in your street, you are the king or queen of Color Strike!

Gameplay:
6 Cards are placed in a circle on the table, 1 of each color.
1 card is placed in the middle of the circle, the color of that card shows what cards you are allowed to play (the card colors next to the same colour card in the circle)

Depending on the type of card you play, it can have some effects:
- Number cards: Nothing happens
- # cards: steel a card from another player en give him one card you don't want.
- Strike Cards: You MAY Place a card on the table to build your straigth, if you place a card, all other players MUST place a card on the table. If you don't, nobody does.

Thez cards should be in the same (color) order as the cards in the circle.

The game ends when each player has 6 cards on the table, you receive points for the longest straigth and #cards.

Name: Nocturnally
Description:
It is night in the forest. It is so dark that the young night animals cannot find their parents! Together with Firefly and Glowworm we will help them out. Can we reunite all the night animals before the sun rises?

Nocturnally is an exciting and challenging variation on the well known Memory game. The players help each other to remember the cards. Several levels of play guarantee many joyful hours!

Name: Crimibox: Dossier Oorlog
Description:
With the arrival of an enigmatic diary, panic erupts at the C.R.I.M. headquarters. The diary turns out to be old and comes from an ominous period in history. It was the key to untold horror many years ago. Can you bury the hatchet before the blood-curdling past repeats itself?

Dive into the mystery and uncover the shadowy past. Play your cards right and you may single-handedly avoid the bloody future that awaits.

Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Colossus & Magik
Description:
Born in Siberia, Piotr Rasputin is a mutant with a skin of steel and a heart of gold. He can transform his entire body into organic metal, granting him superhuman strength, durability, and stamina. Colossus is a gentle giant, however. He is sometimes reluctant to use his physical strength in combat, feeling a responsibility to use his powers to improve the lives of mutants and humankind.

Illyana Rasputin is the younger sister of Colossus. Abducted at a young age by Belasco, the sorcerer and master of the realm known as The Otherplace, Illyana trained in the art of magic and overthrew her captor to become Magik, the Sorceress Supreme of Otherplace! Her mutant ability to teleport herself and others through space and time by using stepping discs, pieces of Limbo that act as a midway point between locations and points in time, allows her to be anywhere and anywhen her mystic power is needed.

This pack gives players the chance to round out their X-Men teams with these powerful characters, beginning with beautifully-detailed, dynamic Colossus and Magik miniatures for them to paint and customize. Already featuring a combination of powerful mutant and mystical abilities, players can unlock even more power from this pair with three Team Tactic cards that allow them to tap into the power of Limbo or throw Wolverine with the famous Fastball Special.

Name: Beau Séjour
Description:
After the discovery of a murder, it's up to a restless ghost and a few brave seers to unravel the mystery. But that could get tricky...

One of you is responsible for this heinous crime and will do everything in his power to go free.

As a seer or ghost, can you find answers to all the dark questions surrounding this murder? Or will you, as a killer confuse the group so they will never find out the horrifying truth?

Name: Lista rätt!
Description:
In this trivia game the players are asked to rank a "top 5" list out of 10 possible answers.

An innovative trivia game that's fun to play with your family and friends.

Lista rätt! is a trivia game with a game-changing idea. Each player is asked to write down a "top 5" list. One question could look something like "Rank the animals' weight" with the 10 possible answers being Elephant, Lion, Rhino, Rabbit, Fox, Coyote, Giraffe, Squirrel, Shark and Butterfly.
At the same time, you have to be a bit tactical hence a wrong answer deducts points from your tally.

Name: Therapy
Description:
A daily dose of Therapy is recommended. Possible side effects; unexpected truths combined with a high risk of bursting into laughter. In this game, players take turns to move their sofa across the playing board in the hunt for mental balance.
Through conversations with the coach, the group therapy and knowledge about yourself and your co-players, you'll get rid of your worries and obsessions.

Dive into your personal reflections. You'll be amazed how people think about - VERY - ordinary things.

The player who answers the questions correctly and can judge him/herself, aswell as his/her co-players, the best wins. The game has been designed by two psychologists and a writer.

Name: Dino Draw 'n Dodge
Description:
The meteors are showering down! as a velociraptor or Raptorex, you are in charge of rescuing the dinosaur population from extinction by collecting as many eggs as you can... but there are other dinosaurs out there trying to steal and eat eggs, and some nasty Apex predators out to get you too! Do you have what it takes to collect the most eggs and fend off the competition?

Avoid meteors, defeat dinosaurs, and collect eggs in an always changing map system where the routes and challenges are never the same!

The person with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner!

Playing solo? try and beat your own personal best!

—description from the publisher

Name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 6 (Jockey) Mini Expansion
Description: Set of horses that comes with the Barnes and Noble version of the game. This Set of horses focuses if the jockey actions and has a symbol of a jockey.

Name: Borikén: The Taíno Resistance
Description:
Borikén — that is, modern-day Puerto Rico — is now home to a people that proudly trace their heritage back to its Taíno, African, and Spanish roots. These three different cultures were brought together by some of the worst measures of the human condition — greed, slavery, and genocide — but the result is a vibrant culture, rich with history and traditions, and known for its beauty and passion.

The Taíno people are gone, but they live on through the people who are trying to connect the broken pieces of their culture almost five hundred years later. To that end, this game tells the story of Borikén through the eyes of the Taíno people, a people who existed and faced their own challenges even before the Spanish arrived on their shores (pre-1493), who rallied together to try to rid their home of the overwhelming invaders (1493-1512), and in failing to do so had to make hard sacrifices so that a few might survive (1512-1529).

In designing and developing Borikén: The Taíno Resistance, we decided that in an effort to convey a holistic picture of the Taíno people, no part of their story could be left out, so the campaign game combines three unique scenarios, each covering one of the three eras of Taíno history, focusing on the type of conflict in which the Taíno people were engaged.

These three game scenarios can be played individually as standalone games or played as a three-part campaign in which the end state of each game serves as the set up for the next. Each game scenario accommodates 2-4 players and takes between 45-90 minutes to play.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: 跳舞戰爭 (Dancing Battle)
Description:
We love to play board games and have opened a board game store, but we found that there is no board game in Taiwan or even in the world where you can dance to music and have fun! That's why Dancing Battle, the world's most entertaining dancing board game, was born.

Table game features

     The dancers flip over the dancing cards and follow the movements on the cards to dance to the music.
     There are various built-in games, such as judging players according to the accuracy of the movements to give points, such as guessing players to answer what card the dancer is dancing, such as dancing mimic solitaire.
     The first danceable party game type table game in Taiwan, which is very rare in the world.
     Created by Taiwan's elite team of research and development.
     People who do not know how to dance can easily play, you can set the level of difficulty, children and the elderly and foreigners can play, the rules are simple five minutes to know.
     The original dance rhythm music.


—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Root: Underworld Hirelings Pack
Description:
Need allies? How much gold do you have? Discover unique strategies and make the Woodland wilder by adding hirelings. Best with fewer players, great with more!

This product includes six new hirelings:

     Sunward Expedition and Mole Artisans
     Corvid Spies and Raven Sentinels
     Furious Protector and Stoic Protector


Hirelings can be added to Root games at any player count. With fewer players, the hirelings add new pieces to the map, ramping up the tension and giving you more tactical options. With more players, some hireling cards will flip over to reveal new special abilities to gain, letting you explore unique and powerful strategies.

—description from the publisher

Name: 戰古人 (Call of Ancient Fighters)
Description:
This is a board game based on the idea of "don't open the textbook at dusk", four modern college students (rich kid, school sister, cat girl, silent boy) vs. five ancient people (Mulan, Qin Shi Huang, Mencius, Pu Song Ling, Zhuang Zi), using the Chinese and Western humanities classics to battle.

The game includes map exploration + card battles + camp rivalry, helping each other or framing each other, it's just a matter of thought.

There are 36 debate cards (a collection of 36 different classical ideas from the East and West!), 5 types of 30 disobedience cards, 9 types of 18 contingency cards, 5 Demon King cards, 4 player character cards, 4 summon cards, 15 Demon King partner cards, and a unique triangle map card designed to match the map for exploration.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game Worldview

Four college students accidentally open the "old Chinese textbook" and fall into a mysterious space.
They are confronted with the obsession kingdom created by five Chinese ancients!
Repeatedly think and reason with the ancient people who are trapped in their obsessions, so that the discourse has power and the words become weapons!

ã€Game Features
Map Exploration + Card Battles

At the beginning of the game, players will first decide their roles, and then explore the map to collect card resources. While deciding on a character, a "summon card" will also be drawn. The player who draws a summon card becomes a demon king summoned by the Ancients and fights against other players secretly.

When a player reaches the end of the map, the map exploration phase will end and the identity of the Demon King will be revealed.
The next step is to enter a one-on-many card battle, where other players have to join forces to defeat the player who has become the Demon King.
Will the player who becomes the Demon King be inspired by the values of the ancients and win?
Or will the player with modern thinking and debating ability be able to overrule the ancients?

Here comes the battle of ancient and modern arguments!
Debate Card: The wisdom of Eastern and Western classical thought will become the basis of your debate.
The "no contest" card: the slippery slope, the face ......, the modern way of "discussing" things, will become your best trick.
The unexpected event card: in the process of exploring the map, the effect card will be randomly drawn, and you have to sense the direction of the wind in case of emergency!

Five Demons, Five Levels
The five demon lords and five levels are drawn by è‘‰é•·é’, the artist who won the 2021 Japan International Manga Award, and have both ancient and modern aesthetics.

Mulan
In this game, you designate the size and wind direction of your own card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and one more "symbolic struggle".
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Mulan + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Emperor Qin Shi Huang
Invalidate the opponent's disobedience card once.
Disobedience card: 5 effects and 1 more "facepalm" card
Debate cards: 3 cards exclusive to Qin Shi Huang + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Menciusï½œI am doing this for you
Replace a card played by your opponent with a blank card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Karma Blast".
Debate cards: 3 exclusive cards of Mengmu + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Pu Songling
You may replace a card from your hand once after you open a duel.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 more "Slip" card
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Pu Songling + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Zhuangziï½œNorthern Meditation with Fish
1. 1 point of blood is returned at the end of each match
2. not take any damage once
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Sleep" card
Debate cards: 3 copies of "Zhuangzi" + 4 blind draws from the debate card pile

Explore the map with the topic!
The map of "Call of Ancient Fighters" combines five issues: gender roles, authority, parenting styles, media literacy, and philosophy of life.

In order to create a richer "educational and fun" experience, both the map design and the play style are intended to combine both the issues and the player's own reading experience.

For example, in the "Mulan" map, we designed three special exploration points: jeans, car keys, and pens. Players need to explore these points and open the map card before they can successfully summon Mulan to appear.

These three exploration points correspond to the "gender roles" we want to convey in this map.
Jeans symbolize the imagination of women who no longer have to conform to a specific feminine temperament.
The fountain pen represents the power of women to speak, to argue, to write, and to enter the public sphere.
The car key is a means of transportation, signifying the independence and mobility of women.

While novels and comics focus more on the plot, the board game is based on the concept of classic humanistic sentences, focusing on the four protagonists, who enter the realm of the Ancients' obsessions and need to defeat them to regain their freedom. The tabletop game is a combination of two modes: map exploration and card battles, plus role-playing and camp battles.

The five ancients (five maps) represent the following issues: Mulan (gender roles), Qin Shi Huang (authority), Mencius (parenting style), Pu Song Ling (media literacy), and Zhuang Zi (philosophy of life).

The cards are divided into two types, one is the "debate cards" which are based on sentences from Chinese humanities classics and Western contemporary thought classics, divided into three main parts: rational, emotional and value, on the one hand, and on the other hand, the cards are played in the way of point size comparison. The second is the "disobedience to battle cards" that use concepts commonly found in modern slang to trigger events or effects, such as: karma detonation, facepalm, slippery slope, etc.

—another description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Hunter's Arsenal Expansion
Description:
The weapons you decide to craft, and the monsters you hunt to craft them, will change the path of each campaign you play. Different hunters need different materials, and more hunters means more options!

These hunters introduce six new weapon classes to transform your campaigns, plus arena quests for the Ancient Forest and Wildspire Waste monsters for one-shot play.

Name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Teostra Expansion
Description:
Today, we’re walking straight into the flames.

Taking on Teostra is like challenging the element of fire. Anything that can burn, will burn.

Teostra stalks the Wildspire Waste at will, an emperor of flame.

Find it, hunters, and end its searing reign!

Name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Kushala Daora Expansion
Description:
Think you’ve learned something about slaying monsters, hunter?

To face Kushala Daora is to take on the power of a storm. You might as well try slaying a hurricane.

And that’s why we’re here! Prepare to have your mind blown.

Name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Nergigante
Description:
Are you sure you’re prepared, hunter?

Nergigante is well-known as one of the toughest threats in the New World. Underestimate this spiked apex predator at your peril. Truly a flagship menace.

To a belligerent elder dragon that so often clashes for dominance with other elder dragons, what threat could you pose?

Be careful not to get impaled on your own pride.

Name: Monster Hunter World: The Board Game – Kulu-Ya-Ku
Description:
Expect the unexpected in these quests.

With its dexterous limbs, this odd monster has been spotted carrying weapons and stealing eggs right from their nests.

Name: The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal
Description:
The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal is the latest edition of The Singaporean Dream, an interactive card game that lets you pay, steal, and sabo your way to be the perfect Singaporean.

You play a classic Singaporean Personality (different for each player) that grants you special powers.

The game goal is to collect as many dream as you can before the dream pile runs out. You can buy the Dream Cards with Cash Cards in the bank or gain them with Action Cards.

During your turn, you draw two cards and play up to 3 actions:

     play an action card from your hand; 
     place money in bank (cards from hand to table);
     buy a dream using money in bank;
     use personality special power.


Keep doing this until the dreams runs out.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – 2021 Arena Starter Kit
Description: This set of two starter decks for Magic: The Gathering is designed to be an easy entry point into the game for two players. It includes two 60-card decks (a green-black deck and a blue-red deck) featuring cards from Adventures in the Forgotten Realms, Strixhaven: School of Mages, Kaldheim, and Zendikar Rising; two cardboard deck storage boxes; a play guide booklet; and a code that unlocks both decks on Magic Arena.

Name: Final Girl: Box of Props
Description:
The Box of Props contains:


    Upgrades:
        Horror Track Miniature
        Deluxe Bloodlust Marker
        Deluxe Time Marker
        Deluxe Final Health Tokens
    



    Promo Final Girls:
        Layla
        Agnes
        Julia
        Constance
    



    New Components:
        The Desperation Die: Once per game you may substitute a regular die with this die. 1-5 is a success, 6 is game over.
        The Book of Desperate Deaths: Desperation Die deaths described.
        Signature Action Cards: Assign your Final Girl one of these special signature actions.
        The Ultimate Dice: Instead of unlocking your Final Girl's Ultimate Ability, you may unlock the special powers of these Ultimate Dice instead.

Name: Cupcake Commotion
Description:
In Cupcake Commotion, players “bake” cupcakes by collecting frosting and cake flavors and laying them down one by one until they have a dozen. But pay attention! Opponent(s) will try and stop you using action cards like Stubborn Oven or Dropped on the Floor.  The first to get to half a dozen cupcakes wins. The game is fast-paced, fun, and can easily pack along in your bag for vacations or camping trips. I created all the artwork on each card.

Cupcake Commotion is for 2-4 players and for ages from 8 to adult. It’s great for family game nights, for kids to play with each other, or to play with friends.

—description from the designer

Name: Kryptik Trading Card Game
Description:
The game of Kryptik can be played by 2 players in our standard format, 4 players in our more casual Krucible format, and requires nothing more than some Kryptik decks to get started. No need for dice, tokens, special mats, or boards. This immaculate card game design allows players to adopt the game more easily and gives players/store owners the option to put on draft or sealed deck events with (literally) just a booster box and some friends.

Each game of Kryptik represents your life on Kryptik Island. You are a citizen with 66 years to prove your worth to the Overseers, and these years are represented by your six 11 year cards. You must work towards victory by slinging spells and commanding your citizen allies to attack your opponent in an effort to destroy all of their 11 year cards. Hit them one more time after you destroy their final 11 year card and you win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: The Good Old Hockey Game
Description:
The Good Ol’ Hockey Game lasts 3 periods. During the game you will try to score more goals than your opponent. You have to shoot to score! But, you can only shoot if you have possession of the puck in your Offensive Zone.

Each period you will play your Player Cards trying to get closer to your opponents goal, in a series of puck battles. During a puck battle, you play cards facedown, hoping to have the highest total. The highest total wins the puck battle and moves one step towards the goal.

Use your 18 cards wisely as you balance going for the go ahead goal and saving your cards for later in the period. Perform a Line Change to save your cards.

If you run out of cards first your opponents will score as many goals as they can with their remaining cards!

-description from designer

Name: On the Hunt
Description:
In this game players take on the roles of hunters, each competing to have the most valuable collection of deer, moose and elk at the end of 5 years!

A roll of the dice determine which animals are available to hunt, then each hunter fights for control over the best hunting grounds to shoot their prized mounts.

Each round you start by increasing you priority for mule deer, moose or elk. The higher your priority, the more likely you are to be given permission to hunt that animal. Next, you all take turns placing your hunter meeples on the 6 different hunting areas. Each hunting area has different animals with different point values. If you have the most hunter meeples in a hunting area, you get to shoot first!

A final roll of the shooting dice determine whether you hit your animal or not! Each hunter meeple you have in the area is an extra shooting dice you get to roll. Will you play it safe? Or risk it for the big haul?

—description from the designer

Name: Eastward
Description:
Official cooperative board game based on the critically-acclaimed video game Eastward.

This cooperative tabletop game sees 2-4 players working together to rescue villagers and defeat enemies, racing against a sinister miasma that threatens to engulf the world — complete with a foldout game board, 15 food cards, 10 item cards, and 4 unique playable character standees.

Two versions of the board game are available for preorder from iam8bit:
- Eastward Exclusive Collector’s Edition (Nintendo Switch)
- Eastward 2xLP Vinyl Soundtrack (Limited Edition Board Game)

Each version can be played independently, or together as an integrated experience.

Name: Defence Net: An invader-busting roll & write game
Description:
Your mission should you choose to accept it:

Defend Earth by setting up strategic defences and unleash massive damage on the invading fleet. Can you complete the mission in 20 turns?


Mission Overview
Player only have 20 turns to avoid space mines and destroy the Invaders fleet. You can perform only one of the following in a single turn:

a) Upgrade your defence
b) Attack the Invaders

Player attack the invaders by upgrading defence points and connecting 2 upgraded defence points with a straight line. Any Invaders within the “box” that the line crosses will take a hit. Default (not upgraded) defence points cannot be used.

A defence point is upgraded by circling it. Function of the defence point increases with the level of upgrade.

Level 1 (represented by 1 circle) - allow player to connect to another defence point
Level 2 (represented by 2 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to one other defence point
Level 3 (represented by 3 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to two other defence point

Combos Madness
3 types of defence point upgrade, 4 different types of Invader with different level of life-meter (some are tougher to destroy than other) and space mines which explode every time you crosses them. Players must plot their attack wisely to max out their mission score, those who destroy all the Invader Ships before the end of 20 turns get extra bonus points!

Print and play: One PDF, thousands of mission
The game come in a single PDF (black and white print cost friendly) which automatically generate random missions each time the file is refreshed on the Internet browser or reopened in a PDF viewer.

Each mission comes with an unique mission code. You can reprint the old mission challenge by typing the old mission code over the newly generated one.

Name: MOOGH
Description:
MOOGH is a 1 to 4-player competitive programmation game where tribes of cavemen are joining forces to defeat big beasts. They will fight in order to decide who should lead the new combined tribes. By hunting Big Beasts, they will win savage points. At the end of the game, if the cavemen win, the team with most savage points may then claim the leadership of the tribe. If the cavemen don’t meet the winning conditions before the end of the game, all the tribes will lose the game.

In MOOGH, the players will have to anticipate the actions from the other tribes and from the beasts (manage by AIs) in order to win Savage points. Each tribe will have its own actions and skills (most of the actions will be resolved by rolling dice and their success will depend of the cavemen characteristics). The game has different ways to counterbalance the randomness of the dice (rage token to reroll dice, idea cards with special actions that can be activated if you meet specific condition, etc.). There are four tribes in the base game and a lot of interesting content (a solo mode, a skirmish mode, a campaign mode, a lot of different beasts, scenario with different winning conditions, items to win, etc.).

—description from the publisher

Name: Hajiku Nemoly
Description:
Hajiku Nemoly is a roll-and-write crossword game inspired by classic Nordic-style fill-in puzzles.

Game lasts 10-12 rounds and each round has three phases: roll, write, and score.

Players collect random word units, use them to build complete words on their crossword grids (simultaneously and secretly), and then score the completed words in multiple categories. Words that are related to adjacent icons give bonus points, but repeating identical words induces a penalty. Special rewards are given for filling rows and columns. The player with most victory points wins.

Game booklet includes 12 thematic scenario grids, each with their own special rules.

All scenarios are naturally suited for solo play with minimal rules differences. Additionally, all word grids may be solved like traditional fill-in puzzles with some new twists.

—description from the designer

Name: Compile
Description:
Compile is a mathematical trick-taking card game for two players, based on Cassino. The deck includes cards numbered 1-15  in 4 suits, or 60 cards in total.

In setup, 4 cards are dealt to each player and 4 face up to the centre. Players take turns putting down one card from their hand and are trying to take as many other cards from the centre as they can. Aces are worth one point each, and two lucky cards are worth three points if captured - 3 of triangles, and 10 of lozenges. Build (compile) piles of cards up over the round, but beware - the other player may be able to capture your pile!

—description from the designer

Name: Endless Winter: Man VS Megalith Promo Card
Description:
An Endless Winter promo card available through the Man VS Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter

Culture card (shuffle into the Era II deck at setup)

Effect: Spend 2 Tools to gain a Tribe card and place a Megalith

Name: Endless Winter: BigFoot Promo Card
Description:
An Endless Winter promo card available through The Secret Cabal 2021 Kickstarter

Animal card (shuffled into the bottom half of the deck at setup)

Effect: During the Eclipse Phase, place a Megalith

Name: Turbofans
Description:
Turbofans is a action- and set-selection game of operations at 15 major, U.S. Airports and 20 minor airports, over the course of 50 years, from 1960 (about the time turbofan-powered, jet aircraft first came on the scene in the U.S.) to 2010, in 10 5-year turns.

The Players will alternate taking actions, performing one or more such actions (depending on how efficient their company is) to purchase Aircraft or Hangars, creating new Flights, or upgrading their airline, so that it is more effective in future actions.

The aircraft return net profits every turn, but each model of aircraft is different and can generate different profits, for varying numbers of turns.  And aircraft will be forced to "retire", as newer, better aircraft become available.

Victory conditions are two-fold, and are scored at the end of each turn - most cash on hand, and most major airports under control.

In addition to this, the game has a Bot system that not only allows every game to have 6 companies, but actually speed up play in the process.

Turbofans comes in two flavors - the Introductory game can be played in 60-90 minutes, and the Standard game comes in around the time it takes to play most 18XX games.  There are also optional rules, regional startup scenarios, and more.

—description from the designer

Name: Assault on Doomrock: Ultimate Edition – Roguelike Expansion
Description:
This new Roguelike expansion allows Heroes to complete challenges in order to level up the content of the game in current and future playthroughs.

Challenge cards are drawn at the start of a session, which can be completed to gain the honor points depicted in the upper corner of the card. Is it worth taking a detour on your path to Doomrock to accomplish one of these challenges? Sure! Nothing could possibly go wrong, could it? Once earned, these points can be used to level up the game semi-permanently. This is comparable to a legacy mechanic, but completely reversible: powered up cards can be removed at any time.

When spending an honor point, Heroes choose which of the 3 types of decks will be upgraded and draw 3 cards from the powered up decks of the Roguelike Expansion. One of the 3 drawn cards is chosen and will replace the card with the same name already in the deck.

The new cards are more powerful versions of their originals, bringing minor advantages like improved stats or reduced attribute requirements.

When upgrading the Ability Deck, cards will often have more powerful effects or easier/improved dice results. As you complete more challenges, more powered up cards will be present in the game decks. These powered up cards will show up in the game more often, tempting you to pick them up from SHOPS and during Level Ups.

This expansion will add some additional decision making and richness, and make the game marginally easier each playthrough.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sleeping Gods: Distant Skies (Gamefound Edition)
Description:
The Gamefound Collector's edition comes in a bigger and nicer box (featuring gold foil and embossing) than the retail edition, features a painted airplane miniature, and includes 3 extra combat dice, 15 metal stamina tokens, a miniature for each of the five playable characters (the retail edition has cardboard standees, also included in the Collector's edition), and the Thunderstorm Isle expansion.

Thunderstorm Isle

Thunderstorm Isle is a faraway location outside of the atlas that you can fly to in your plane. It includes 40 adventure and quest cards, a new map, wandering encounters, and a small storybook.

This is a wet and muddy isle filled with danger and mysteries. Also, you must take care not to be struck by lightning in the almost ever-present storms!

You can include this expansion in any of your Distant Skies campaigns, even your first. Unlike the distant locations in the game, Thunderstorm Isle is an entire map with multiple locations. Explore Thunderstorm Isle at any time by using a flight action. To leave the island, simply move to your plane and return to the game atlas.
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Peanut Butter Belly Time
Description:
You are peanut butter makers for Nerdy Nuts!

Decide what flavors you want to create from Chocolate Marshmallow to Banana Cookie and everything in between, then prepare your jars and collect the right ingredients for your special peanut butter creations. You can add mystery ingredients for extra flavor, but don't push your luck too far or your sweet treats might end up too salty instead!

In Peanut Butter Belly Time, players draft ingredient cards to create jars of peanut butter. Each card also has a scoring rule on it, but only one card will score for each jar. Players may take orders from a central display if they can fulfill them, and an order replaces a jar's normal scoring. Players can also compete for ingredient majority cards.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: TRAILS: Storehouse Badge Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available during the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstater campaign.

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game. The "Storehouse" badge costs 1 less of the card's resource type to earn, for each badge earned previously that turn.

Name: Battle Command Volume I: The Battle of the Bulge and Operation Crusader
Description:
Building on the innovative gameplay of his Fast Action Battle (FAB) Series, designer Rick Young has reimagined the best parts of FAB to introduce a new game system: Battle Command. The goal of the Battle Command system is to provide a fresh and engaging way for various conflicts across different eras to be fought with minimal time wasted on setup and complex rules, making this both a great introductory system for new and veteran players alike. 
 Each Battle Command volume includes TWO different games in one box. Volume I brings players to the forests of the Battle of the Bulge, and the sun, heat, and sand of North Africa during Operation Crusader. The design emphasis has been placed on making the game very player-friendly and manageable in its level of scope, difficulty, and time of play. With a low total counter count and density, these quick playing (though still realistic) simulations present players with deep strategy meriting contemplation. A system of map areas has been adopted, and movement has been streamlined.

For those who prefer to use a paper map, or who would like to be able to set up both games side by side, we are including a double-sided paper map along with the double-sided mounted map. This is for those of you who have 3 friends who would like to play, or play at conventions, or just plain prefer a paper map.

Battle Command (BC) is a refinement and simplification of the old Fast Action Battles (FAB) game series. Those familiar with the FAB games will recognize that the scope is the same, with higher echelons, artillery, events, and combat assets that can be assigned as available. FAB however was rules intensive and procedural, and those elements have been streamlined in the BC series. Most players do not need to pick up the rulebook after the first turn or two, as everything you need to play has been printed on the map, including a flow-chart with extended sequence of play so that no turn segment will be overlooked, and your attention will be placed solely on the battle at hand. Special rules needed for each event are printed directly on the event cards, so you can play them and forget them without having to refer to the rulebook.

Components:
Two Rulebooks
220 playing cards (110 per game)
1 double-sided mounted map (34"x22") with one game on each side
1 double-sided paper map (34"x22") with one game on each side
2 counter sheets
4 Player Aids
2 dice

-description from publisher

Name: TAG: The Card Game
Description:
Get points, draw strategically, and freeze the competition; all while avoiding the dreaded IT card!

Players will play and discard cards to rapidly match T, A, and G cards to make sets. The deck is the main source of cards, but if you're lucky, someone may discard a card that you could use!

Sometimes, you'll draw a Special Card instead of a letter card. Depending on which one you get, they can be great for attacking the competition or defending yourself!

—description from the designer

Name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Fungal Dwarves Faction Deck
Description:
Cultivate your colony of spore warriors with the Fungal Dwarves! Nurture the cycle of growth and decay to overwhelm the enemy summoner with an unending chain of fungal fighters! Kuldak is the centerpiece of the fungal colony, converting death into growth for his nearby allies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Śpiochy
Description:
Åšpiochy ("Sleepyheads") is a game that helps the youngest children calm down and prepare to sleep.
The players close their eyes as one of the adorable animals falls asleep under the quilt.
Which animal was it? What was the color of the quilt? Which toy was it playing with during the day?

The game offers flexible difficulty levels and several gameplay variants (including a competitive one).

Large animal tiles, charming artwork, and three-dimensional bed bring a unique experience to the little ones.

Åšpiochy to gra, która utuli do snu kaÅ¼de dziecko. Wyciszy najmÅ‚odszych graczy 
i sprawi, Å¼e kÅ‚adzenie siÄ™ do Å‚óÅ¼eczka  stanie siÄ™ jeszcze przyjemniejsze.

Kilka wariantów rozgrywki, przepiÄ™kne ilustracje zwierzÄ…tek  i trójwymiarowe Å‚óÅ¼eczko zauroczÄ… wszystkich maÅ‚ych Å›piochów.

Name: Bordélocratie
Description:
Bordélocratie is a game that puts players at the heart of the French political "bordel" (or shambles). Find yourself at the head of a political party that will leave its mark on the Fifth Republic (or maybe just a dent).

But to reach the supreme position of President and get to move into the Elysée palace, you must first increase your popularity, get more votes in the Assemblée et vote laws for the good of your part... country !

Designed as a party game that can also be played in a more political version (longer, more intense and with more knives stuck in your back by the end), a game lasts around 1 hour and brings to the table 4 to 6 fans of the best televised political debate of the Fifth Republic, or 4 to 6 players who want to feel powerful while disdaining your nobody opponents (until they become somebody).

HOW TO PLAY

Every turn, players draw 2 Action cards then can only play one.
Then the First Player draws three Bills, submits one to the Assemblée and draws a second random one.
Players vote on the Bills submitted (each one giving victory points to player based on specific conditions).
Then the turn end and we start again.

THE ACTION CARDS

The Action cards you get to use have different abilities. Events change the course of the game, Campaign increases your popularity and backers bring you more weight at the Assemblée. You can also play fraud cards to turn the tide in your favor, or rip the tide away from another player.

ELECTIONS

Mimicking the Constitution of the French Fifth Republic (with a few liberties of course) every 5 turns, a President will be elected in a two round system. In the first round only the two players with the most popularity get to the second round. Then for the second round, every other players has to endorse one of the two finalists and lend them their own popularity.

WINNING

At the end of turn 12, it's time to see who collected the most victory points through being elected or Bills that gave your points based on the backers you have accumulated.

Of course there is much more to discover in the cards and positions within the government, but that's for you to discover in the game !

—description from the designer (English)

Bordélocratie est un jeu qui vous plongera dans le bordel politique de la Ve République. Vous aurez l'occasion d'incarner de grands partis qui marqueront l'histoire du pays et qui vous propulserons au sommet : à l'Élysée !

Mais pour ça, il vous faudra réunir des soutiens de tout bord, avoir plus de voix à l'Assemblée, voter des lois et faire campagne.

Créé comme un party game qui peut être joué en version politicarde (plus longue, plus intense, avec plus de couteaux dans le dos), une partie dure environ 1h et réuni autour d'une même table entre 4 et 6 personnes, passionnées des grands débats télévisés de la Ve République ou simplement qui veulent à leur tour se sentir puissant·e·s tout en méprisant leurs adversaires politiques qui ne sont rien (jusqu'à-ce qu'ils ou elles le deviennent).

COMMENT JOUER

Chaque tour, tout le monde pioche 2 cartes Action puis en joue une seule.
Ensuite, le ou la Premier·e joueur·euse pioche 3 cartes Loi et en propose une à l’Assemblée avant d’en tirer une 2e qui est soumise aussi à l’Assemblée.
Tout le monde vote sur les propositions de Loi (chacune donne des points de victoire selon des conditions spécifiques).
Puis le tour se termine et on passe au suivant.

LES CARTES ACTION

Les cartes Action que vous pouvez utiliser ont plusieurs rôles. Les Événements changent le cours du jeu, les Campagne vous permettent d’augmenter votre popularité et les Soutiens vous apportent plus de Voix à l’Assemblée. Vous pouvez aussi jouer des cartes Fraude pour tirer la couverture à vous, ou la retirer d’une autre personne qui la veut pour elle ou lui.

ÉLECTIONS

En imitant la Constitution de la Ve République (avec quelques libertés bien sûr) tous les 5 tours un·e Président·e est élu·e dans un système à deux tours. Au premier, seules les deux personnes avec le plus de Popularité passent au second. Puis, pour le second tour, tout le monde qui n’a pas passé le premier doit soutenir un·e des deux finalistes en leur prêtant sa popularité.

GAGNER

À la fin du 12e tour, c’est l’heure de trouver un·e vainqueur. La personne avec le plus de points de victoire (obtenus par des élections ou des Lois) gagne le jeu, la politique et toute la République.

Il y a bien sûr encore plus à découvrir dans ce jeu, à travers les cartes, les rôles au sein du gouvernement etc, mais ça c’est à vous de le découvrir !

—description from the designer (French)

Name: Sydney (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
A fan expansion for Ticket to Ride based on the train and bus networks in the city of Sydney, Australia.

Map background created by Stamen Design and used under CC BY 3.0

Name: Rainbow Pets
Description:
Everyone loves animals, especially puppies! But you even more so. And that's why you're off to the world's most exotic destinations in search of the cutest little ones.

Rainbow Pets is a cute, simultaneous pick and choose game where you play together, with a turn-based pick and bluff mechanism.

Players, each turn, choose six puppies to bet on with inverted tokens, to vote hidden: three of them (depicting a paw on one side) are real, while the remaining (blank) are bluffs. When all players have finished their tokens, they proceed to reveal them; bluffs are discarded. If only one player has a valid token on the card, the puppy is adopted by the owner, adding at the end of the game the victory points indicated at the top of the card. If several tokens are placed on the puppy card by different players, the puppy is cuddled, producing the effect shown at the bottom of the card. Adopted puppies are replaced in the same number by other cards. The winner is the one who, at the end of three rounds, has the most victory points.

Name: Dino Draft
Description:
Stegosaurus, triceratops, brachiosaurus and pterodactyls are out in force!

Aim of the game: Score the maximum number of points. Choose carefully as the cards are passed from player to player, as you can only pick one card each turn.

At the beginning of the game, the players receive 2 "mission" cards, colors and types of dinosaurs. For Every card in a player's hand with the same colour or dinosaur as their "mission" cards at the end of the game, the plaer scores 1 point.

The game is played over several "pick and pass" rounds: during these rounds, the players receive cards and each turn, each player chooses any one card to keep, before passing the remaining hand to the player on their left.

After the final round of "pick and pass", each player counts their points from the cards in front of them.

Name: Hush: Evergreen Pass
Description:
March 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

     Map postcard: Evergreen Pass
     Character card: Czibo
     Nocturnal Creature card: Zoella
     Spirit card: Skeleton Spirit

Name: The Awakening of Cerberus
Description:
In Greek mythology, it is said that a young man named Orpheus used the "tone of the lyre" to put Cerberus to sleep, and in The Awakening of Cerberus, all three heads start the game asleep.

The two players want to collect all the souls of their allies while not losing their own lives in the process. To that end, it is important for you to co-ordinate your strategies since Cerberus may wake if the strategy shifts. An awakened Cerberus head will attack to re-capture the souls it has collected, but you can possibly send it back to sleep. Due to the darkness of the Netherworld, however, free communication between the players is restricted.

Name: Buen Camino
Description:
For centuries, the Camino de Santiago has brought together pilgrims from all over the world who, for different reasons, decide to undertake their journey year after year.
Be the first to arrive at the Cathedral of Santiago and win.

In Buen Camino, two to four players will competitively build and move through the "camino" - the way of Saint James. In a turn, players usually place a "camino" path card, play an event card or move their piece to another card. Some cards have events (blisters, storms, etc), others activities (time to eat, walk with someone, etc), and even equipment (map, raincoat, etc).
The first piece to reach the Santiago de Compostela Cathedral Place wins!

Name: Throne of Under
Description:
Throne of Under is a strategic, turn-based table-top adventure game. Two to four players move their characters on the map across sixteen lands to the very last land. Players use the playing cards to move, battle faerumentals: the monsters of these lands, and challenge opponents. The goal is to be the first one to collect four keys to open the Throne room, enter it and win the last battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Veiled Fate: Kickstarter Exclusive Age and City Cards
Description: 6 additional Age cards and 6 additional City cards that were given to backers of the campaign.

Name: The Grand Carnival: On the Road
Description:
The carnivals in this town just got even bigger! Clowns, enormous attractions, golden tickets, and more peanuts than you can handle, all arriving by train in the next week. And you’re taking this show on the road, stopping in cities across the ol’ US of A. Can you create the greatest carnival this country has ever seen?

This expansion introduces multiple modules to add to your games of The Grand Carnival, as well as new Tricks of the Trade cards to play with. And for more variety, players can choose a unique city to visit, which have different scoring conditions for players to shoot for.

—description from designer

Name: Summoner Wars (Second Edition): Eternal Council Faction Deck
Description:
The Eternal Council's summoner Praefectus Edia welcomes you to study alongside her, moving from the academy to the battlefield! With her quick wit and knack for research, Edia can rapidly draw through your deck and combine your event cards in a way that will surely teach your foe a lesson!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blazing Skates
Description:
Blazing Skates is a sport game that recreates short track races of winter Olympic sport.
The game is played along a printed rink divided in sectors and boxes.
From 2 to 5 skaters can skate in a single race.
2d6 dice are used to move skaters and tables help to resolve any aspect of game.
Each skater is represented by individual cards 
A set of Ladies and Men skaters are published: World Championship 2021-2023 and Olympic Games Beijng 2022 500m race.

It's a free print and play game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pirates Dragons Treasure
Description:
Pirates Dragons Treasure (PDT) is a competitive tabletop card game for 2-6 players.  Take on the role of pirate captain and race to be the first to defeat the dragon!

Dish out devastating curses, claim valuable bounties, recruit pirate crews and equip your ship with powerful upgrades to increase your odds of victory.  PDT is a lightweight, swashbuckling adventure that’s easy to learn and quick to play.

—description from the designer

Name: ナゼカヨメチャウ (Why can I read this?)
Mantle of the Keeper
Description:
The Keeper of Vaile has fallen and chaos has enveloped the realm. The time has come to find someone worthy to take up the Mantle of the Keeper and bring order to Vaile. The protectors of the Cosmos, known as the Ascended, have each selected their own candidates, called Chosen, to compete in the Keeper Trials.

In this 2-4 player card-driven skirmish game, players take on the role of one of six Chosen characters to either battle head to head or on teams to become the next Keeper of Vaile. In Mantle of the Keeper, each Chosen has its own individual playstyle, deck of cards, and abilities, allowing players to leverage its Chosen’s strengths. Construct the arena to create a fierce battle experience while placing Hazard tokens to push the limits of movement and strategy. Utilize your Chosen’s distinctive skill set to unleash devastating attacks upon your foes. Counter the attacks of your rivals with powerful defenses to gain Favor, which can be spent to upgrade your Chosen and use your unique abilities.

Do you have what it takes to overcome your opponents and take up the Mantle of the Keeper?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Unknown Soldiers
Description:
The Unknown Soldiers is a solitaire game of squad-level combat during World War 2 by designer Gottardo Zancani.  The Unknown Soldiers is designed and played in the style as the award-winning Space Infantry series.  Players will conduct several Missions as either the United States or German forces.  Players can play either a single mission or as part of a full campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Flesh and Blood: Classic Battles – Rhinar vs Dorinthea
Description:
Designed to welcome new players to the world of Flesh and Blood, Classic Battles: Rhinar vs Dorinthea includes two 40-card decks ready to play out of the box, Cold Foil hero and weapon cards, Rainbow Foil equipment, full art mentors, a quickstart playmat, and a 48 page illustrated lore booklet telling the tale of these heroes and how their classic battle became stuff of legend.

A beautiful product for new players, casual gamers, collectors, and fans of Rhinar and Dorinthea alike.

Name: Religion
Description:
As a village leader, you want to help your people be as happy as possible. You can improve their happiness by sending them to one of the four temples; at the end of the round, the most pious at each temple will get the biggest happiness boost. You may find it more efficient to bus them from the temples to the local bar, casino, or market for some immediate happiness. Even better, you might get them to come back to the temples again afterwards.

Players start with an identical supply of six action cards, and there are six different action cards in the pool. In each of the four rounds, players assemble a hand of cards to play from their supply. Then, one card at a time, they choose a replacement card from the pool (getting a bonus from the top of the card) to go to their supply, before playing one of their hand cards and discarding it to the pool.

Once per game, a player can enlist one of the six advisors for a unique and powerful advantage. Timing is tricky: Some are better if taken earlier, some later, but each player may only take one, and each may only be taken by one player.

The game is played over four rounds, with two to six actions per player per round. (Two at the start, but more may be earned.)

Name: Unseen Domains
Description:
In a world plunged into chaos by the Witchplauge, humanity grapples to survive. But with struggle, comes the endeavor for revival. The Unseen Domains are treacherous, but might lay the foundations of a new future if it is not destroyed by greed first.

In Unseen Domains the players compete for victory points over three rounds using their unique decks. In the end, the player who has the most victory points wins. During the rounds, each player can perform actions by playing their cards. Actions are used to recruit new units and move them, activate area abilities, and perform various maneuvers for a positional advantage.

Victory points are scored for controlling the domains at the end of each round. They also let the players use the given area's abilities. In the Wilderness, various quests can be completed for powerful Bloodshards.

Each player can perform actions in their turn, but only one of each action type. With certain abilities, and the precious Bloodshards, this limitation can be exceeded, so the pace of the game can be manipulated.

Once the first player has run out of cards, the round ends. Everyone else has one more turn to play, and the player who ended the round gets a free bonus action. With this bonus action in mind, it might be worth it to play your hand as early as possible. But some players who read the game well can make an even better deal by leaving the bonus to the others.

The key is to carefully assess your options, use the abilities to your advantage and time your actions right. Those who can do this can dominate the Unseen Domains.

Name: Sapiens
Description: Sapiens is a simple shape+colour recognition game in which players try to find an image shown on two cards. Each card features four symbols (mammoth, club, fire and woman), each with a background in one of four colours (red, blue, green, yellow). One player reveals one card and chooses symbol (and its colour in the card), saying it in the in-game "prehistoric language" (mammoth = mamu, club = gra, fire = ouw, woman = bula). All players must then play a card that matches the said symbol and colour. Whoever does that, says another different symbol, and so on. Whoever runs out of cards first wins!

Name: Good & Bad Deeds
Description:
This is Print&Play game with dice management on good and bad deeds background. In this game is very big pressure for dice results manipulations.
There is a theme here of managing the reputation track and balancing between good and bad deeds.
Each round you roll one die for choose environtment (outside or inside) for available deeds. Then you roll three dice and use them for one of different actions. Finally you aim to achieve both end goals at the end of the game - one from Reputation Type and one from Reputation Amount. It you achieve both end goals you won.

Name: Donieck Airport
Description:
