This small game for the Battles of the XXI Century system covers the fierce fights for the Donieck Airport in the 2014-15 between Ukraine and Donbas separatists, supported by Russia.

There are two scenarios for the game, covering fights in 2014 and 2015. These are not covering all the fights, but showing one day of combat from each stage of the battle. Players are allowed to extend each scenario to make it longer.

Game uses B-XXI system rules and ownership of at last one of the boxed games of this system is required, because of the rules, markers etc.

Game was published in the 45 issue of the TiS magazine in both Polish and English editions.

Name: Cedynia 972
Description:
This small game covers the battle of Cedynia. An army of Mieszko I of Poland defeated forces of Hodo or Odo I of Lusatia on 24 June 972, near the Oder river. This battle if often seen as the first documented battle in the history of Poland.

Game contains three scenarios, each of them covers one of the stages of battle. They are meant to be played together, one after another to reflect the entire battle. But players are also allowed to play each of these as stand alone scenario.

Game uses Medieval system rules and ownership of one boxed games of this system is required for the rules, tables and markers.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Dígalo con Lápiz
Description:
Objective of the game
Advance to the end of the board deciphering the drawings made by your game partner.

Flow of the game
The cartoonists of each couple spin the wheel and whoever gets the letter closest to the beginning of the alphabet will be the first to play.

The first cartoonist spins the Letter Wheel again and places his pawn on the first square that contains the letter obtained. He then takes a card without others being able to see it and activates the hourglass.

From the word card, the player must take only the one whose initial is the letter indicated by the spinner.

The cartoonist makes a drawing that tries to communicate the indicated word to his partner in the most faithful way possible. His partner must decipher it before the end of the time indicated by the hourglass, counting on the initial letter as a help.

If the partner manages to find the word within the time, the cartoonist will spin the roulette again and the team advances with its pawn to the square that contains the indicated letter, another card is taken and the game is played again. If he does not succeed, the couple's turn ends and the cartoonist must deliver the Letter Wheel to the cartoonist to his left.

End of the game
The couple that, by spinning the wheel, advances and exceeds the last box wins. In case of falling in the last one, you will have to use your turn normally.

Name: Wakde 1944
Description:
This small game is an expansion for the Pacific 1941-45 by TiS in its Battles of the World War (B-35) system. It covers battle of the Wakde island (Operation Straight Line) fought between 17 and 21 May 1944.

The operation involved an assault on the Wakde island group by a reinforced US infantry battalion, which was transported from a beachhead the Allied troops had established around Arara, on the mainland, the previous day.

There are map, counters and a single scenario sheet. Ownership of the Pacific 1941-45 is required to play.

Game was published in the 44 issue of TiS magazine in the Polish language only.
Families: Series: Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: The Singaporean Dream: 2021 Booster Pack
Description:
The Singaporean Dream: 2021 Booster Pack captures the most iconic moments of 2021, and features newly created cards you can add to your existing The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal deck.

This booster pack consists of 30 cards including:
2 NEW Personality Cards featuring the Delivery Rider and Sovereign.
5 NEW Dream Cards such as Food Arrives on Time and Dining In Again.
17 NEW Action Cards featuring the good, bad, and funniest moments of 2021.
6 Cash Cards.

With the TSD 2021 Booster Pack, you can expand your game of The Singaporean Dream: The New to include 2 to 8 players (previously max. of 6 players).â€‹

Name: Dibu Dilo
Description:
Up to 4 teams of 2 or more members are formed. Each team chooses a starting artist, but everyone must draw at some point, as it rotates each turn.

On each turn, a team spins the wheel, it will indicate a color. Advance to the next square of that color. The player who draws on that turn, removes a card from the deck of words, and must try to represent by drawing the word to guess (according to the selected color). After making the drawing, his partner will try to guess the word in an agreed time.

The draftsman cannot add details to the drawing or speak while his partner tries to get it right, he can only guide him by indicating one of the orientation symbols on the board: Almost, On the track, Wrong idea, Combine, Sounds similar, First-second (for words compound). If you guess the word, you get 1 point.

There is also the possibility of all teams playing in one turn, or challenging another team to guess the word.

The team that gets 10 points first wins.

Name: Small Time Crooks
Description:
Small Time Crooks is a 15 minute RPG Card game that blends narrative mechanics and strategy into a short and sweet heist experience.

Small Time Crooks works in three stages:

In the 'Case the Job' phase, you'll gain intel on the target, letting you plan the best route. Then, during the heist stage, you'll break in, overcoming obstacles and reaching the score. Finally, in the escape stage, you'll race to one of the exits before the guards are alerted.

Small Time Crooks is a cooperative, GM-less game that uses targets, or pre-built locations with scores, to steal. The base game comes bundled with 10+ targets to rob, and players can also build their own.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle's Shadow: The Battle of Fort Donelson, February 15, 1862
Description:
“Events have cast on our arms and hopes the gloomiest of shadows.” –Jefferson Davis’ diary entry about the fall of Fort Donelson and the surrender of nearly 15,000 Confederate soldiers.

Battle’s Shadow is an historical simulation of the battle fought on February 15, 1862 at Fort Donelson. The fort was a Confederate stronghold on the Cumberland River, and key to the rebels retaining control of Kentucky and Tennessee. General Ulysses S. Grant’s Army of the Tennessee and Admiral Andrew H. Foote’s ironclad gunboats had laid siege to the Confederate fort, trapping the Confederate Army of Central Kentucky. On the morning of February 15th the rebels launched a desperate attack in attempt to breakout. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of Battle's Shadow is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map sheets
176 un-mounted, double-sided counters
8 pages of rules

Each turn in Battle’s Shadow represents one hour of time. Infantry and Cavalry units represent regiments (III) or battalions (II). A hex on the map is approximately 200 meters across. Battle's Shadow is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.

—description from the designer
